channel.title: Python
channel.description:
Hello all,
I recently started learning python, like 2 days ago, and I wrote this small program. What it basically does is that you have to guess a number between 1 and 10. I know it's really easy for some of the more advanced programmers, but it's a great way for me to learn it.
[code=python]from random import choice
Numbers = range(1,10) Guess = choice(Numbers)
print("Hello, and welcome to") print("guess the number!")
while True: print("Choose a number between 1 and 10.") player_input = input(">") if (not player_input.isdigit() or int(player_input) not in Numbers): print("You can't use this number.")
else: Guessed = int(player_input) if Guessed != Guess: print("Wrong number!") if Guessed == Guess: print("You guessed right!") print("The number was:", Guess) break[/code]
I would appreciate it if someone could take a look at the code and tell me what I did wrong, or what I could do more efficient.
Thanks for your time, Halflive9

item.title: Python
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Hello all,

I recently started learning python, like 2 days ago, and I wrote this small program. What it basically does is that you have to guess a number between 1 and 10. I know it’s really easy for some of the more advanced programmers, but it’s a great way for me to learn it.

[code=python]from random import choice

Numbers = range(1,10)
Guess = choice(Numbers)

print(“Hello, and welcome to”)
print(“guess the number!”)

while True:
print(“Choose a number between 1 and 10.”)
player_input = input(">")
if (not player_input.isdigit() or
int(player_input) not in Numbers):
print(“You can’t use this number.”)

else:
        Guessed = int(player_input)
if Guessed != Guess:
        print("Wrong number!")
if Guessed == Guess:
        print("You guessed right!")
        print("The number was:", Guess)
        break[/code]

I would appreciate it if someone could take a look at the code and tell me what I did wrong, or what I could do more efficient.

Thanks for your time,
Halflive9

Read full topic
